drug.name: Vintafolide
drug.description: Vintafolide is a folate-targeted chemotherapeutic conjugate (folate vitamin + vinca alkaloid) in clinical stage development as a treatment for folate-receptor positive cancers.

article.citation: Leamon CP, Reddy JA, Vlahov IR, Westrick E, Parker N, Nicoson JS, Vetzel M: Comparative preclinical activity of the folate-targeted Vinca alkaloid conjugates EC140 and EC145. Int J Cancer. 2007 Oct 1;121(7):1585-92.

Reddy JA, Dorton R, Westrick E, Dawson A, Smith T, Xu LC, Vetzel M, Kleindl P, Vlahov IR, Leamon CP: Preclinical evaluation of EC145, a folate-vinca alkaloid conjugate. Cancer Res. 2007 May 1;67(9):4434-42.

drug.indication: Investigated for use/treatment in solid tumors.
drug.mechanism-of-action: Vintafolide minimizes the off-target toxicity by delivering the vinca molecule directly and specifically to cancer cells that over-express the folate-receptor. Once delivered to the cancer cell surface, Vintafolide is internalized into the cancer cell via endocytosis, a natural cellular process. Once inside the cell, Endocyteâ€™s proprietary linker technology releases the chemotherapy to eliminate the cancer cell.

classification.description: This compound belongs to the class of organic compounds known as vinca alkaloids. These are alkaloids with a dimeric chemical structure composed of an indole nucleus (catharanthine), and a dihydroindole nucleus (vindoline), joined together.

atc-code.level: PLANT ALKALOIDS AND OTHER NATURAL PRODUCTS

drug-interaction.name: Peginesatide
drug-interaction.description: The risk or severity of Thrombosis can be increased when Peginesatide is combined with Vintafolide.

drug-interaction.description: The metabolism of Vintafolide can be decreased when combined with Posaconazole.

polypeptide.name: Folate receptor beta
polypeptide.specific-function: Binds to folate and reduced folic acid derivatives and mediates delivery of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate and folate analogs into the interior of cells. Has high affinity for folate and folic acid analogs at neutral pH. Exposure to slightly acidic pH after receptor endocytosis triggers a conformation change that strongly reduces its affinity for folates and mediates their release.

go-classifier.description: anchored component of external side of plasma membrane
regulation of thymidylate synthase biosynthetic process

polypeptide.name: Folate receptor gamma
polypeptide.specific-function: Binds to folate and reduced folic acid derivatives and mediates delivery of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate to the interior of cells. Isoform Short does not bind folate.

polypeptide.name: Folate receptor alpha
polypeptide.specific-function: Binds to folate and reduced folic acid derivatives and mediates delivery of 5-methyltetrahydrofolate and folate analogs into the interior of cells. Has high affinity for folate and folic acid analogs at neutral pH. Exposure to slightly acidic pH after receptor endocytosis triggers a conformation change that strongly reduces its affinity for folates and mediates their release. Required for normal embryonic development and normal cell proliferation.

go-classifier.description: anchored component of external side of plasma membrane
ER to Golgi transport vesicle membrane
cardiac neural crest cell migration involved in outflow tract morphogenesis
neural crest cell migration involved in heart formation
regulation of canonical Wnt signaling pathway
regulation of transforming growth factor beta receptor signaling pathway
